about.description:
This packages changes how Pandas and Polars DataFrames are rendered in Jupyter Notebooks. With `itables` you can display your tables as interactive [DataTables](https://datatables.net/) that you can sort, paginate, scroll or filter.
ITables is just about how tables are displayed. You can turn it on and off in just two lines, with no other impact on your data workflow.
The `itables` package only depends on `numpy`, `pandas` and `IPython` which you must already have if you work with Pandas in Jupyter (add `polars`, `pyarrow` if you work with Polars DataFrames).
about.summary: Pandas and Polar DataFrames as interactive DataTables

about.description:
This packages changes how Pandas and Polars DataFrames are rendered in Jupyter Notebooks. With `itables` you can display your tables as interactive [DataTables](https://datatables.net/) that you can sort, paginate, scroll or filter.
ITables is just about how tables are displayed. You can turn it on and off in just two lines, with no other impact on your data workflow.
The `itables` package only depends on `numpy`, `pandas` and `IPython` which you must already have if you work with Pandas in Jupyter (add `polars`, `pyarrow` if you work with Polars DataFrames).
about.summary: Pandas and Polar DataFrames as interactive DataTables

name: itables
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "itables" %}
{% set version = "2.1.0" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/itables-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7c013060d78041bddf7ee19db57ab4aff9f1e68333fc5cd03969c8c9a56e6691

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - nodejs
    - python >=3.8
    - python-build
    - hatch-jupyter-builder
    - hatchling
    - pip
  run:
    - ipython
    - pandas
    - numpy
    - python >=3.7

test:
  imports:
    - itables
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/mwouts/itables
  doc_url: https://mwouts.github.io/itables/quick_start.html
  summary: Pandas and Polar DataFrames as interactive DataTables
  license: MIT
  license_file:
    - LICENSE
    - LICENSE_jquery.txt
    - LICENSE_datatables-net.txt
  description: >-
    This packages changes how Pandas and Polars DataFrames are rendered in Jupyter Notebooks.
    With `itables` you can display your tables as interactive [DataTables](https://datatables.net/)
    that you can sort, paginate, scroll or filter.

    ITables is just about how tables are displayed. You can turn it on and off in just two lines,
    with no other impact on your data workflow.

    The `itables` package only depends on `numpy`, `pandas` and `IPython`
    which you must already have if you work with Pandas in Jupyter (add `polars`, `pyarrow` if you
    work with Polars DataFrames).

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - mwouts
    - asford
